> My question is this - does jUnit instantiate my TestCase class for
> each test method that I have?

yes.  For each methods 'testXYZ' the methods of your TestCase object are 
called in the following order: setUp, testXYZ, tearDown.

if you do some integration tests, you have to start/stop the server once 
for all of your tests -> use a TestSetup to "encapsulate" your main 
testsuite.

    Test suite() {
       TestSuite suite = ...
       suite.addTestSuite(...)

       return new TestSetup(suite) {
           public void setUp() {
              /* start you server here */
           }

           public void tearDown() {
              /* teardown your server here */
           }
       }
    }

The tearDown method is not executed in a finally block, it means that if 
you have errors/failures in your tests, the server will not be closed 
properly.  To fix this, use the junitx.extension.TestSetup class of the 
junit-addons package (the tearDown is executed in a finally block).
